summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from late August 2019 discussing investigative updates on the Epstein case, including scheduling interviews with an inmate and corrections officers, serving a subpoena, and coordinating daily reporting to FBI Headquarters. It reveals internal strategy regarding media narratives, focus on co-conspirators, and preparations for an upcoming court hearing.

persons.name: Keith Outlaw
persons.context: An inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) who was being visited by an individual named Harris. The FBI received approval to interview him.

persons.name: Harris
persons.context: An individual who was visiting inmate Keith Outlaw at MCC. This person is scheduled for a further proffer session on September 4, 2019.

connections.description: Harris was visiting inmate Keith Outlaw at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), as noted in the FBI's investigative update.

events.title: Interview of MCC Corrections Officer
events.description: An interview of one Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) Corrections Officer was scheduled for 4 PM, location to be determined, as part of an obstruction investigation.

events.title: Subpoena Served on Motel
events.description: FBI agents served a subpoena on a motel and planned to obtain the results on Thursday, August 29, 2019.

events.title: Harris Proffer Session
events.description: An individual named Harris is scheduled to come back in for a further proffer session with investigators.

events.title: Meeting with Motel Personnel
events.description: FBI agents planned to meet with motel personnel to receive and review documents related to their subpoena.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively investigating potential obstruction and other crimes related to the Epstein case, including interviewing MCC corrections officers and serving a subpoena on a motel.

Internal strategy focused on managing media narratives, specifically regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's role, and emphasized staying focused on charges for a different co-conspirator based on the volume and quality of evidence.
FBI Headquarters mandated daily conference call updates at 1530, indicating high-level oversight and pressure on the investigation.
The document references an upcoming significant court hearing on a Tuesday, for which the FBI was preparing to report on victim attendance and coordination.
Investigative efforts included analysis of phones and determining the nature and timing of likely charges against co-conspirators.
